intro: Hieracium tenebrosum, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist and shady conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a dark center. Hieracium tenebrosum is often found in clusters, with multiple flowering stems emerging from a single root system.
